{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3550857,"name":"","username":"Plunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T00:59:56.836Z","cooked":"

Consistently every 5 seconds a couple of overrun errors occur. However, if new code is deployed or robot code is restarted the over run errors go away entirely. Restart the code again and they come back. Essentially, every other time robot code was restarted or redeployed there would be intermittent overrun errors. This was consistently observed. We are using robotpy 2025.3.1.1, a RIO 2 and a new black radio. I would assume that it is not an issue with our code because it does not change when the robot code is restarted and because there is nothing in the code that is updated every 5 seconds. I can also not think of any physical aspect that would cause this only after every other robot code restart. Any thoughts as to why this might happen would be appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T00:59:56.836Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":38,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":224.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70825,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3550881,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T01:42:29.940Z","cooked":"

If there’s a link to your code I’d be interested in taking a look.

Does the driver station logs indicate anything else when this occurs? The log viewer should have a record.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T01:42:48.892Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/2","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551217,"name":"","username":"Plunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T16:11:56.944Z","cooked":"

The driver station logs show that the roboRIO’s CPU% is spiking every 5 seconds. The driver station does not complain about anything other than overruns as errors. Here is the code. The over run errors occur even when the robot is disabled so the code you would want to look at would be in disabled periodic.

self.hardware.update(self.buf, self.time) is defined in robotHAL.py in the class RobotHAL. This is where the most amount of time is taken up based on my profiling though I highly doubt that this code is directly causing this issue.

Some other notes about the code:

There is a RevMotorController class that I defined that is just a wrapper class for the Rev motor controller interface. SwerveModuleController is a swerve module class that just bundles two RevMotorController classes together. The only code that I am aware will take a significant amount of time is at lines 529 to 533.

self.motor.configure(
self.config,
SparkMax.ResetMode.kResetSafeParameters,
SparkMax.PersistMode.kNoPersistParameters,
)

configure() in my experience will cause over run but the if statements it is inside of should never be true without modifying some values.

One last note about the repo. There are tests for black and mypy. If you end up running tests these will certainly fail on your system without proper configuration so just delete tests/black_test.py and tests/mypy_test.py.

Please ask if you have any questions about the code.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T16:11:56.944Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":31.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Team-4536/FRC-2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - Team-4536/FRC-2025","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":11063,"username":"virtuald","name":"Dustin Spicuzza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70825,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551242,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T16:55:18.698Z","cooked":"

What versions do you have installed on the robot? robotpy installer list will get that for you. Then, make sure everything is at the latest version and see if it reproduces – don’t use robotpy_extras in your pyproject.toml, switch those to use requires and pin them to whatever the latest versions are.

The initial version of revlib had some CPU related issues, but I think they were simulation only. Make sure you’re on 2025.0.2.

Since this is very deterministic, I think I would try to remove code to figure out which particular thing is causing it. It’s going to either be NetworkTables related (unlikely, but you never know) or something related to querying the hardware (more likely).

One way that you can isolate whether it’s NT or hardware is causing the issue is by relating your table objects with a mock that doesn’t do anything. If it gets rid of the problem then it’s NT, if it doesn’t then it’s probably related to a hardware query.

Thinking about that, in the driver station logs are there corresponding spikes in CAN utilization also?

On the topic of NT, updating networktables all the time can cause CPU issues – but I would expect that to be a constant problem, not a periodic problem. One way that you can make this slightly more efficient (which matters for Python, less for other languages) is by using network table entries instead of putXXX:

# don't do this
table.putNumber("thing", value)

# do this instead in your constructor
self.thing_entry = table.getEntry("thing")

# and update the value this way
self.thing_entry.setFloat(value)
","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T16:55:18.698Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70825,"username":"Plunder","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/4","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555482,"name":"","username":"Plunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T20:46:13.808Z","cooked":"

The robot has the most recent versions of packages installed. Revlib was on 2025.0.2.

I uploaded an empty robot.py with nothing in robotInit, robotPeriodic, disabledInit, or disabledPeriodic. The the CPU was still spiking in usage though no overruns were occurring. This would rule out NT or any hardware querying on my end.

The CAN utilization does not spike in correlation with CPU usage.

I tested the same code on a Rio1 and was not able to reproduce the CPU spikes. I replaced the SD card on the Rio2 with a new image and it still showed CPU spikes.

This is when there is no code in robot.py running on the robot.

Screenshot 2025-03-12 1542002872×1796 331 KB

Well that’s certainly interesting. I know you said robot.py was empty, but can you upload the exact robot.py and pyproject.toml that you used? I can try to reproduce.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T21:06:55.762Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":28.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70825,"username":"Plunder","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/6","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555620,"name":"","username":"Plunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T22:55:04.035Z","cooked":"

This is not exactly what I used when I was writing my previous post but I was able to replicate the problem with this minimal of a pyproject.toml and robot.py. I uninstalled and reinstalled python on the Rio2 before deploying this and testing it. I also tried robotpy 2025.1.1 and still saw the CPU spike.

pyproject.toml:

[tool.robotpy]
robotpy_version = "2025.3.1.1"
requires = []

robot.py:

import wpilib
class Robot(wpilib.TimedRobot):
    def robotInit(self) -> None:
        pass

    def robotPeriodic(self) -> None:
        pass

    def disabledInit(self) -> None:
        pass

    def disabledPeriodic(self) -> None:
        pass
","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T22:55:04.035Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":11063,"username":"virtuald","name":"Dustin Spicuzza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70825,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555734,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T01:43:19.604Z","cooked":"

I hadn’t read your post carefully enough – I don’t have a rio2 available to me, so I can’t try to reproduce it. However, another WPILib team member mentioned they noticed this same issue with Java. I’ve created an issue to track it: Periodic CPU spike on Rio2 · Issue #7859 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

One working theory is that something (lvrt most likely) is trying to start a new robot process after some timeout. The robot process is killed after you import wpilib, so if you just added something like this to the top of your empty robot.py:

import datetime
with open('/tmp/wat', 'w') as fp:
    fp.write(str(datetime.datetime.now())

# then add import wpilib et al

You can get the contents of the file via:

robotpy installer sshcmd 'cat /tmp/wat'

If this is happening, then you should see the date of the file incrementing every time there is a CPU spike.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T01:43:19.604Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":26.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/issues/7859","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Periodic CPU spike on Rio2 · Issue #7859 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70825,"username":"Plunder","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/8","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555786,"name":"","username":"Plunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/plunder/{size}/254736_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T02:47:10.612Z","cooked":"

I have been looking at what the RIO2 is running while SSHed inside of it. Using pstree I noticed a difference in execution between when spikes are occurring and when they are not.

When there are no overruns the frcRunRobot.sh command is this

     |-lvrt-daemon---su---MainAppThread---frcRunRobot.sh---bash-+-
     |                                                          |-python3
     |                                                          `-tee

When there are overruns the robotpy frcRunRobot.sh command is this

     |-frcRunRobot.sh---bash-+-FRC_ConsoleTee
     |                       |-python3
     |                       `-tee

I am not knowledgeable enough to understand the difference here and maybe this is not cause or just a symptom. I just noticed that depending on weather or not the overruns are occurring the command is different.

A shell script that I have been looking at from the RIO2 that may be related is lvrt-daemon. It seems to handle some logic related to crashing and restarting.

Here is the entire pstree command output for both when the CPU is overrunning vs when it is acting normal.

No overruns occurring:

init-+-NI WSD Watchdog---SystemWebServer---6*[NIWebServiceCon]
     |-S88FRCNetComm---su---FRC_NetCommDaem
     |-avahi-daemon---avahi-daemon
     |-crond
     |-dbus-daemon
     |-2*[getty]
     |-2*[ifplugd]
     |-jitterentropy-r
     |-lkads
     |-lldpd---lldpd
     |-lvrt-daemon---su---MainAppThread---frcRunRobot.sh---bash-+-FRC_ConsoleTee
     |                                                          |-python3
     |                                                          `-tee
     |-niauth_daemon
     |-nipalps---cat
     |-nirioserver
     |-nirtmdnsd
     |-nisvcloc
     |-rtctld
     |-sshd---sshd---bash---pstree
     |-syslog-ng
     |-udevd
     |-udhcpc
     `-vsftpd

Overruns occurring:

init-+-NI WSD Watchdog---SystemWebServer---6*[NIWebServiceCon]
     |-S88FRCNetComm---su---FRC_NetCommDaem
     |-avahi-daemon---avahi-daemon
     |-crond
     |-dbus-daemon
     |-frcRunRobot.sh---bash-+-FRC_ConsoleTee
     |                       |-python3
     |                       `-tee
     |-2*[getty]
     |-2*[ifplugd]
     |-jitterentropy-r
     |-lkads
     |-lldpd---lldpd
     |-lvrt-daemon---su---MainAppThread
     |-niauth_daemon
     |-nipalps---cat
     |-nirioserver
     |-nirtmdnsd
     |-nisvcloc
     |-rtctld
     |-sshd---sshd---bash---pstree
     |-syslog-ng
     |-udevd
     |-udhcpc
     `-vsftpd
","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T02:47:10.612Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494688,"topic_slug":"mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":11063,"username":"virtuald","name":"Dustin Spicuzza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70825,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mysterious-overrun-error-every-other-robot-code-restart/494688/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555830,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T03:24:30.354Z","cooked":"

In the case where you have overruns, if you run pstree often enough, do you have the robot code script also show up in the lvrt-daemon part of the tree. Thats what at least I suspect is happing. lvrt-daemon is continously attempting to restart your program, while there is already that instance running independently.

We’re also confused on why that independent running instance is happening. It shouldn’t be happening.

When I say restart robot code I mean hitting the restart robot code button on the DS. I see the same thing happen when I hit the restart RIO button on the DS and when I redeploy.

I will see what lvrt-daemon does with pstree when I get the chance. When I ran top however I did not see any noticeable spikes though I am not sure about top’s resolution.
